item.title: Report X-2023090402
item.description:
Report X-2023090402

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA found package leaking on dock during dock walk. Went to move package to a different spot and saw the bottom was damp, package was put into a red tote and brought to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that one corner of one bottle was somehow punctured during handling and or transit, which caused internal leakage. Unsure of how bottle was punctured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottle was set upside down to prevent further leakage and kept in a lined tote till it was drummed up. Spill pad was used to clean up leaked product.

item.title: Report X-2023090285
item.description:
Report X-2023090285

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap was loose on the plastic pail causing it to leak. We cleaned up the spill with neutralizer. We secured the soiled clean up materials and package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.
